newsitem.title: UK: Cairn expects Soco to accept bid for Command.
newsitem.headline: Cairn expects Soco to accept bid for Command.

text.p: Cairn Energy Plc said on Wednesday it was confident that SOCO International Inc (SOCO) will accept its agreed offer for Australia's Command Petroleum Holdings Ltd and also declared its bid unconditional.

Cairn chief executive Bill Gammell said, "We are confident, now the offer has been declared unconditional and following the recommendation of the Command board, that SOCO and Command's other shareholders will now accept the Offer."
SOCO owns around 105.2 million shares, amounting to 32.6 per cent of Command's share capital and had said it is likely to accept the offer.
Cairn announced on October 2 it had made an agreed offer for Command, which valued the firm at A$365 million.
The offer is scheduled to close on November 22.
